content.description: First bolt is a little high.  Crux is pulling through roof from 3rd to 4th bolt.  Really fun climb, takes some time to figur out the beta.
content.protection: 6 bolts plus to draws for the anchors.
content.location: Shares the last three bolts with Rage in Eden.  Start just to the right of Rage in Eden.

content.description:
A tricky layback of a right trending flake system into some large moves on some good and not so good holds through the steeper upper section.

 A knee pad may be useful for a knee scum.
content.protection: 7 bolts, plus 2 bolts at the top for chains.
content.location: Same start as American Graffiti. One route left of the arete which is Blade Runner. After third bolt, head right. 4 more bolts to the top.

content.description: Progressively more difficult climbing leads to a steep boulder problem through the roof/ bulge (fun!). Catch your breath at the big rail, then a funky rock over and some 5.10ish pockets will see you to the top. Acceptable rock quality and great movement on this.
content.protection: A mix of bolts to glue-ins just over lip. Everything seemed relatively solid.
content.location: Furthest right bolt line in the big scoop on the left side of the wall. Just left of Bingo's Revenge. Scramble up ledges to the base.

content.description: Have not climbed.  Shares the last three bolts of Ultimate Violence.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus 2 draws for the top.
content.location: This is the route farthest to the left, located on top of the 4'th class scramble to the right of Plant Food.

content.description: Crimpy.  Pockets and crimps.  If you stop at the cahins after the 6'th bolt, it's around 11.d.  If you keep goin to the top, watch out for 12.a.  First crux is between 4'th and 5'th.  Next is between 6'th and chains.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus 2 draws for the top of the 5.11d section. 2 more bolts after the chains to get to the top.
content.location: At the main wall, It's the farthest left route.  Start just right of the dihedral.  After the second bolt, head right.

content.description: Link up of TON-TON and Blade Runner. Climb the start of TON-TON to the juggy rest then trend right and up clipping an independent bolt and finishing on Blade Runner.
Cruxy after 4th bolt. After the 5th, you can do a variation and go right to the middle chains of plant food, or keep going to the top.
content.location: Same start as Plant Food.  After clipping second bolt, head left.  I think either the 4'th or 5'th bolt has broken off.

content.description: Start off on easy jugs up to a thin flake. From here it’s an awkward crimpfest power struggle between every bolt. You’ll reach a crack/flake with some decent holds, enjoy them because just above is a series of drilled two finger pockets and one arm pull ups to just below the top. Extremely sustained!
content.location: Just to the right of "Plant Food".  On main wall.

content.description: Climb the left side of the arete with a crux about halfway up.
content.protection: 7 bolts, plus 2 bolts at the top for chains.
content.location: Obvious arete on the right side of the wall.

content.description: Pull through crimps, a couple slopers, and then to a slab.  After the slab, you go through the roof to the top.
content.protection: 6 bolts.  Either the 1'st or 2'nd bolt is not that secure.  The rock has chipped awaw below it, leaving about a 1/4" of the bolt exposed.  Go through this section carefully.
content.location:
This route is directly left of Elastique.  There are a couple of ways to start it.  You can either do the same start as Elastique/Plant food.  Put a long runner on the second bolt and head way left up the sloppy dihedrial. Clip first bolt and go. 

  Or you can walk up the easy 5'th class stuff just to the left of Plant food and belay from just under the first bolt, skipping the dihedrial.  If you do it this way, it's 6 bolts total.  8 bolts the other way.

content.description: Follows the beginning flake section on Ton-Ton before branching left into two distinct boulder problems with a rest in-between. The first boulder problem is fairly straight forward on small edges (V6) while the second boulder is very distinct and powerful. Revolving around a brutal gaston or undercling (V9). The upper section is pumpy and sustained with a final throw at the end to a continuously degrading sloper.
content.location: Shares the same starting bolts as Ton Ton before branching left up the steep headwall.

content.description: This is the main attraction.  A few hard sport climbs which are very easy to top rope.  Developed back in the day by Steve Glotfelty and Doug Mishler.  A few of the bolts are kinda sketchy.
